sentence.Network_en: Thousands are desperately trying to leave their battered homes.
sentence.Network_cn: 成千上万的人不顾一切地想要离开他们千疮百孔的家园。

sentence.Network_en: Battered pine floors slanted down to a Georgian window.
sentence.Network_cn: 破旧的松木地板歪歪斜斜地铺到一个乔治王时代风格的窗户跟前。

sentence.Network_en: Frank Mariano negotiates the desert terrain in his battered pickup.
sentence.Network_cn: 弗兰克·马里亚诺驾驶他那辆破烂不堪的皮卡车成功穿越了沙漠地带。

entry.def: Something that is battered is old and in poor condition because it has been used a lot.

example.ex: He drove up in a battered old car.
example.tran: 他开着一辆又老又破的旧车。

means.word_mean: 1. damaged by blows or hard usage;

auth_sentence.content: But last year, these investments battered the fund.
auth_sentence.res_content: But last year, these investments battered the fund.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But last year, these investments battered the fund.

auth_sentence.content: New England was battered with winds and heavy seas.

auth_sentence.content: Who will end up bruised, battered and dripping wet?
